channel.title: R Sofware on Vijay Waghmare
channel.description: Recent content in R Sofware on Vijay Waghmare

item.title: Aggregation functions using R Software
item.description: Objective: To predict Energy consumption using temperature and humidity of Kitchen and Outside, and Visibility (Five explanatory variables). Dataset: The ‘LasVegas’ dataset is a Multivariate dataset that provides details on 504 TripAdvisor reviews of the 21 hotels located in the Strip, Las Vegas. Models: Aggregation functions Weighted Arithmetic Mean (WAM), Weighted power means (WPM with p = 0.5 and 2), Ordered Weighted Average (OWA), and Choquet integral (Fuzzy measure) using R software.

item.title: Probability, Bayesian Statistics, Clustering, Mixed Gaussian Distributions using R Software
item.description: Objective: This was rigorous task involving solving problems mathematically manually and then by R programming. It covered basic topics from Probability, Bayesian Statistics, Clustering, Mixed Gaussian Distribution. Dataset: HeronIslandWaterTemp.csv IOCdata2020.txt LZIsData.csv Models: Linear regression, Kmeans clustering, NormalMix MOdels Click for complete solution Link to Github Repository

item.title: Graph theory and Bayesian Network using R Software
item.description: Objective: This was rigorous task involving solving problems using Graph theory and Bayesian network and its inference on hailfinder dataset. Dataset: hailfinder Models: Graph theory and Bayesian Network Click for complete solution Link to Github Repository

item.title: Kmeans and Hierarchical Clustering
item.description: Objective: Clustering customers based on Gender, Age, Education years, and Wages. Useful in demographic research in marketing or political analytics. Dataset: Wages datasets from Damodar Gujarati’s Econometrics Book Models: Kmeans and Hierarchical Clustering Click for presentation on solution Link to Github Repository

item.title: Stock market prediction - ARIMA and Holt's Winter Smoothing
item.description: Objective: Comparison between ARIMA and Holt’s Winter Exponential Smoothing (With and Without trend) Dataset: Random time series data and Bharti Infratel stock (now ticker INDUSTOWER on NSE India) Models: ARIMA and Holt’s Winter Exponential Smoothing (With and Without trend) Click for explantory comments Link to Github Repository
